parts: In wordpress admin, how do I create a menu, where each item can have subitems

To create a menu in WordPress where each item can have subitems (i.e., a dropdown menu), follow these steps:

1. **Log into WordPress Admin:**
   - Go to `https://your-site-url.com/wp-admin` and log in with your credentials.

2. **Navigate to the Menus Section:**
   - From the Dashboard, go to **Appearance** > **Menus**.

3. **Create a New Menu (if not already created):**
   - If you don't have a menu, create a new one by clicking the **Create a new menu** link.
   - Give your menu a name (e.g., "Main Menu"), then click the **Create Menu** button.

4. **Add Menu Items:**
   - On the left side, you'll see options for **Pages**, **Posts**, **Custom Links**, and **Categories**.
   - Select the items you want to add to the menu by checking the boxes next to them and clicking the **Add to Menu** button.

5. **Create Submenu Items:**
   - Once items are added to the menu, you'll see them listed under **Menu Structure** on the right side.
   - To make an item a **subitem**, drag it slightly to the right under the parent item. WordPress will indent the item to show it is now a subitem (child) of the item above it.

6. **Arrange the Menu:**
   - You can drag and drop menu items to arrange them. Drag items under others to create more sublevels, making a hierarchical dropdown structure.

7. **Assign the Menu Location:**
   - Below the menu structure, you’ll see **Menu Settings**. Assign the menu to one of the available locations (e.g., Primary Menu, Header Menu, etc.), depending on your theme.

8. **Save the Menu:**
   - Once you're satisfied with the structure, click **Save Menu**.

### Preview
- Go to your website to see the menu. Hovering over a menu item with subitems should reveal a dropdown.

Let me know if you need further assistance with styling or customizing the dropdown menu.
